title: (x) Woodhaven-Brownstown School District logo - Abaddon {Mike Y}
content:
I’m trying to figure out the font used for the two bigger letters ’WB’...

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [WBlogo.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20080827235221/http:/typophile.com/files/WBlogo.gif) | 2.69 KB |

 [‹ (x) Ice Age movie logo - Fink Gothic {Dav}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080827235221/http:/www.typophile.com/node/18625 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Baskin Robbins ice cream label - Heatwave, Berthold Block, Gill Sans {James, Cerilene} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080827235221/http:/www.typophile.com/node/18582 "Go to next forum topic")
author: cdleeman

comments.content:
The WB comes from [’Abaddon’](http://web.archive.org/web/20080827235221/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/scriptorium/abaddon/), a Scriptorium font from David Nalle. He attributes it to work by Alfonse Mucha, which was also interpreted by Alex Jay, for interior titles in a 1981 book called ’The Dinosaurs’, by William Stout.

- Mike Yanega
